summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021, forwarding a January 2020 exchange between an FBI Special Agent and an FAA Law Enforcement Assistance Program (LEAP) official. The FAA official provides detailed aircraft registration and ownership information for several helicopters and jets associated with Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, including tail numbers, ownership histories, and signatures on key documents.

persons.name: Ghislaine Noelle Maxwell
persons.context: The FBI agent states Maxwell has used/piloted the aircraft in question and traveled frequently with Jeffrey Epstein. Her pilot certificate details are provided.

persons.name: Lawrence P. Visoski, Jr.
persons.context: Signed the current registration documents for helicopters N722JE and N331JE on behalf of the registered owner, Hyperion Air LLC.

persons.name: James D. Clark
persons.context: Signed as the seller for ASI Wings LLC when it sold helicopter N722JE (Sikorsky S-76C) to Hyperion Air LLC in June 2019.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.role: Signatory on aircraft registration and bill of sale
persons.context: Signed aircraft registration documents for Freedom Air International, Inc. and as the seller for Hyperion Air, Inc. when it sold helicopter N331JE to Hyperion Air LLC in 2013.

persons.name: William P. Merriam Jr
persons.context: Signed as the seller for Bovale Developments, Inc. when it sold helicopter N331JE (then registered as N901RL) in March 2012.

persons.name: Van Heurck
persons.context: The FAA official asks the FBI if this surname has any relevance to the case, suggesting they were a potential pilot of one of the aircraft.

connections.description: The FBI agent states Maxwell "traveled with him frequently" on the aircraft associated with Epstein.
Visoski signed registration documents for aircraft (N722JE, N331JE) owned by Hyperion Air LLC, which Maxwell used/piloted.
Indyke signed documents related to the ownership and sale of aircraft (N722JE, N331JE) used by Maxwell.

events.title: FBI Request for Aircraft Information
events.description: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force sends a detailed request to the FAA for information on aircraft associated with Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FAA Provides Aircraft Registration Details
events.description: An FAA LEAP official responds with extensive registration, ownership history, and LLC documents for multiple helicopters and jets, including N722JE (Air Ghislaine 2) and N331JE.

keyFacts: The FBI was investigating Ghislaine Maxwell's use of specific aircraft (helicopters N722JE, N331JE, N491GM and jets N212JE, N120JE, N909JE, N908JE) in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case.

Aircraft ownership was traced through a complex web of LLCs, including Hyperion Air LLC, ASI Wings LLC, Freedom Air International, Inc., Air Ghislaine Inc., Shmitka Air Inc., Hyperion Air, Inc., and Bovale Developments, Inc.
Ghislaine Maxwell held a private pilot certificate issued in 2007 and was specifically identified as the pilot of the Sikorsky S-76C helicopter nicknamed 'Air Ghislaine 2' (tail number N722JE).

The FAA official provided detailed chain-of-title information, including dates of purchase, registration, and signatures of individuals like Lawrence Visoski, Darren Indyke, James Clark, and William Merriam.

The communication shows coordination between the FBI and FAA's Law Enforcement Assistance Program (LEAP), with the FAA official taking care to provide relevant information while protecting privacy (PII) and offering certified copies for court.
